thread.title: New Orleans Saints left tackle Terron Armstead out vs. Eagles
thread.title_full: New Orleans Saints left tackle Terron Armstead out vs. Eagles | NJ.com

author: Mark Eckel | For NJ Advance Media
title: New Orleans Saints left tackle Terron Armstead out vs. Eagles
text:
Most of the talk this week was about the health of the Eagles' offensive line, it should have been about the health of the New Orleans Saints line.
Saints left tackle Terron Armstead, who injured his knee last Sunday in the team's win over the Dallas Cowboys, has been ruled out for Sunday's game against the Eagles. Veteran Saints guard Jahri Evans is listed as questionable with a knee injury that has sidelined him for two weeks.
It appears both Eagles tackles — Jason Peters (quad) and Lane Johnson (knee) — are going to play, Sunday.
Rookie first-round pick Andrus Peat will make his first NFL start at left tackle in place of Armstead.
RELATED : Saints scouting report
Here's what two scouts said about Peat before the draft:
"He's talented, probably the most talented of them all. And he's a left tackle, for sure. But he's raw, real raw. He won't be ready right away. If you can wait, that's fine.''
And the other. . .
"Rare talent, good size, strength, smarts he has it all. He's just really young (21). He's going to be a really, really good player.''
